verses.roman:
netra-nābhi, vadana, kara-yuga caraṇa,
ei aṣṭa-padma kṛṣṇa-aṅge
karpūra-lipta kamala, tāra yaiche parimala,
sei gandha aṣṭa-padma-saṅge

synonyms: netra—the eyes; nābhi—the navel; vadana—the face; kara-yuga—the palms; caraṇa—the feet; ei—these; aṣṭa—eight; padma—lotus flowers; kṛṣṇa-aṅge—in the body of Kṛṣṇa; karpūra—with camphor; lipta—smeared; kamala—the lotus flower; tāra—of that; yaiche—like; parimala—the fragrance; sei gandha—that fragrance; aṣṭa-padma-saṅge—is associated with the eight lotus flowers.
translation: "Kṛṣṇa's eyes, navel and face, hands and feet are like eight lotus flowers on His body. From those eight lotuses emanates a fragrance like a mixture of camphor and lotus. That is the scent associated with His body.
